definition: in linguistics, a type of epenthesis, where a consonant is added to the middle of a word
details:
noun
- in linguistics, a type of epenthesis, where a consonant is added to the middle of a word
= example: in linguistics, a type of epenthesis, where a consonant is added to the middle of a word
- in pathology, an abnormal outgrowth or enlargement of some part of the body
= example: in pathology, an abnormal outgrowth or enlargement of some part of the body
- something that bulges out or is protuberant or projects from its surroundings
= example: something that bulges out or is protuberant or projects from its surroundings
= synonyms: extrusion
